content.rendered:
FEBRUARY 2025

Message

cover story

UPDATES

in focus 1

in focus 2

civic driven change

partnerships

in the news

Partnerships

AVI-OIL

AVI-Oil has renewed their association with Smile Foundation for the 7th year and are supporting our education programme in Faridabad, Haryana with the specific objective of establishing FLN labs.

Avantor Foundation

In its second year of partnership with Smile Foundation, Avantor is extending their support towards a mobile healthcare project that will bring healthcare services at the doorsteps of underserved communities in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu.

Aditya Birla Capital Foundation

In its third year of partnership with Smile Foundation, ABCF have extended support to improve the quality of education in 15 schools in Siddharth Nagar and Shravasti, Uttar Pradesh, and for mobile healthcare projects in Ahmednagar and Aurangabad, Maharashtra.

Berger Paints

In its third year of partnership with Smile Foundation, Berger Paints have extended their support towards three more iTrain on Wheels, making a total of 23 projects operational on ground aimed at upskilling the painter community.

Bajaj Finserv

Bajaj Finserv have renewed their support to 27 skilling centres across India under Smile Foundation's livelihood programme. The project will benefit over 4,000 underserved youth.

Bharat Connect

Bharat Connect has joined hands with Smile Foundation to amplify awareness on the welfare of children and families. They are engaging users and raising awareness about critical social causes that contribute to building a better society.

Clifford Chance India

Clifford Chance joined hands with Smile Foundation for the Manali Disaster relief initiative by improving access to healthcare services for the underserved communities through the upgradation of Primary Healthcare Centres.

CBRE India

CBRE India's Ek Pehal initiative is supporting Smile Foundation’s mobile healthcare programme to bring essential healthcare services to underserved communities in Bangalore, Hyderabad, Chennai, and Mumbai.

Corona Remedies Pvt Ltd

Corona Remedies has partnered with Smile Foundation to champion the ‘She Can Fly’ initiative, dedicating part of monthly proceeds to our women empowerment initiative, with the support of 25,000 doctors.

Evonik

Evonik has extended its support to facilitate STEM education under Smile Foundation’s education programme in two schools in Mumbai & Thane, in addition to their existing support for four schools across Maharashtra.

GlaxoSmithKline Asia

GSK has partnered with Smile Foundation under its education programme by lending support to establish STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) labs at education centres in Delhi & Lucknow.

Honda

Honda has renewed their support towards empowering adolescent girls, pregnant women and lactating mothers under the women empowerment programme, and improving the quality of education in schools of Pali and Tapukara.

Knight Frank India Pvt Ltd

Knight Frank has partnered with Smile Foundation for supporting two education centres in Maharashtra and providing equitable access to quality education for children from underserved communities.

Mars & Wrigley

Mars & Wrigley is supporting Smile Foundation's women empowerment programme by strengthening government health infrastructure. They are lending support to refurbish Anganwadi centres and improve maternal and child healthcare.

MSD

MSD is extending its existing support to Smile Foundation's healthcare and education initiatives. They are providing scholarship support to girls for pursuing higher education in pharmacy. They are also collaborating for the Smile on Boat mobile healthcare initiative in Assam.

Philips India Ltd

Philips has continued its support towards Smile Foundation's healthcare programme through four ongoing Telemedicine Units in aspirational districts of Pune, Mewat, Gadag, and Virudhnagar.

Pernod Ricard India Foundation

PRIF has joined hands with Smile Foundation’s healthcare programme by supporting two new mobile healthcare projects in Assam and Telangana, in addition to renewing support for three ongoing projects.

Quantiphi

Quantiphi has expanded its support for the scholarship programme for girls from underserved communities to pursue engineering. The merit-based scholarship prepares the girls to become industry-ready engineers.

Relaxo

Relaxo has extended its support towards providing quality primary healthcare services at the doorsteps of underserved communities in 11 villages of Rajasthan through Smile Foundation’s mobile healthcare programme.

RIRCM India Pvt Ltd

RIRCM has renewed its support for the tenth year and is extending its support towards Smile Foundation's skilling and education programmes for children and youth from underserved communities.

Shell India

Shell has partnered with Smile Foundation to support the Design Thinking module, encouraging 47,000 students to work on science experiments focused on sustainable development goals from Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Kerala.

Spreading Happiness India Foundation (SHIF)

SHIF has joined hands with Smile Foundation to work on Green Energy Infrastructure and raise awareness among children and teachers from 180 schools on the subject from multiple states of India.

SBI Cards and Payments Services Limited

SBI Cards and Payments Services joined hands with Smile Foundation to support the distribution of 1,000 food and hygiene kits under its disaster response initiative for affected families in Wayanad, Kerala.

TCPL

As part of its ongoing association with Smile Foundation, TCPL has renewed its support towards conducting multiple health camps in Haridwar, Guwahati, Silvassa, and Goa and providing healthcare support to underserved communities.

Tacterial Consulting Private Limited

Ditto Insurance, a corporate insurance agent headquartered in Bengaluru, Karnataka, partnered with Smile Foundation to support the education of children from underserved communities under the Every Child in School initiative.

WSP Consultants

In their third year of partnership with Smile Foundation, WSP Consultants are supporting the education programme with the aim of providing holistic quality education to underserved children in Bangalore and Noida.

HDB Financial Services

HDB have extended support for static clinics under the aegis of HDB's Transport Aarogyam Kendra (TAK), for setting up a new physiotherapy centre at Indore, besides the three existing centres in Delhi, Ranchi, and Ludhiana.

J.P. Morgan Stanley

J.P. Morgan is supporting four skilling centres under Smile Foundation's livelihood programme in Mumbai, Bangalore, Delhi, and Hyderabad. The project focuses on providing 21st-century employability skills training to youth.

Get monthly newsletter updates
